## Useful Info

**Rupert the Wild** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") human [berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") who always wields a branded two-handed weapon. He'll attempt to disable you before rushing in, dealing obscene damage when [berserked](/Berserk "Berserk").

## Location

- [The Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"):12-15
- [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair"):3-6
- The [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"):1-2
- [The Snake Pit](/The_Snake_Pit "The Snake Pit"):1
- The [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest"):1

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                    |                                                      |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Paralyse](/Paralyse "Paralyse")                   | [Vocal flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")   |
| Slot2       | [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse")                      | [Vocal flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")   |
| Slot3       | [Berserker Rage](/Berserker_Rage "Berserker Rage") | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- All sources of [paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis") are extremely deadly, and Rupert is no exception. You can be paralysed for up to 5 turns. During this time, Rupert can berserk, close 6 tiles of distance, and still get 1-2 attacks off. You might not die, but you'll be next to a berserk Rupert, who can deal 54+ damage per swing. Good [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is recommended if you want to fight him.
  - A sudden Rupert appearance can turn a bad situation into a horrible one. Say you were having trouble against a [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra"). Being paralysed next to said hydra is almost certain death.

- Even if you ignore the paralysis threat, he is a fairly dangerous opponent for Lair. He is strong enough to punch through melee fighters at this point in the game, and has enough HP to shrug off weaker attacks.

- Rupert has the resistances of a [death yak](/Death_yak "Death yak"): his [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is great, and his [HD](/HD "HD") is quite high. [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes"), hex [wands](/Wand "Wand"), [datura](/Datura "Datura") darts, and [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud") are unlikely to be effective.

- Thankfully, he has no other resistances, beyond what equipment might give him.

  - [Curare](/Curare "Curare") darts, if he isn't wearing [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") armour, will slow him down. This lets you keep pace with a berserk Rupert, and makes him weaker overall.
  - If he spawns with an [axe](/Axe "Axe"), Rupert can mow down weak summons like its nothing. However, a few [cactus giants](/Cactus_giant "Cactus giant") are strong enough to take him down, axe or not.
  - Rupert cannot [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible"). If you need to get away, or get an edge in combat, a [potion of invisibility](/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") can help.
  - If you got decent [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") skill, a [phial of floods](/Phial_of_floods "Phial of floods") prevents him from using Paralyse (but does not prevent berserk).

- Rupert has a chance of spawning with one of the rare two-handers, such as a [triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword") or [executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe"). It's great if you were looking for one, but actually taking it from Rupert is easier said than done.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Rupert could [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible").
- While he and his spell set were unchanged, with the removal of the [Berserker Rage](/Berserker_Rage "Berserker Rage") player spell and the changing of [Crusaders](/Crusader "Crusader") to [Skalds](/Skald "Skald"), Rupert was restyled as a Trog worshiper in [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"). The text for his Confuse and Paralyse spells was changed to match: apparently one can induce confusion and paralysis by yelling loudly enough.

Useful Info

Rupert the Wild is a unique human berserker who always wields a branded two-handed weapon. He'll attempt to disable you before rushing in, dealing obscene damage when berserked.

Location

  • The Dungeon:12-15
  • The Lair:3-6
  • The Orcish Mines:1-2
  • The Snake Pit:1
  • The Spider's Nest:1

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Paralyse Vocal flag
Slot2 Confuse Vocal flag
Slot3 Berserker Rage Natural flag

Tips & Tricks

  • All sources of paralysis are extremely deadly, and Rupert is no exception. You can be paralysed for up to 5 turns. During this time, Rupert can berserk, close 6 tiles of distance, and still get 1-2 attacks off. You might not die, but you'll be next to a berserk Rupert, who can deal 54+ damage per swing. Good willpower is recommended if you want to fight him.
    • A sudden Rupert appearance can turn a bad situation into a horrible one. Say you were having trouble against a hydra. Being paralysed next to said hydra is almost certain death.
  • Even if you ignore the paralysis threat, he is a fairly dangerous opponent for Lair. He is strong enough to punch through melee fighters at this point in the game, and has enough HP to shrug off weaker attacks.
  • Rupert has the resistances of a death yak: his willpower is great, and his HD is quite high. Hexes, hex wands, datura darts, and Mephitic Cloud are unlikely to be effective.
  • Thankfully, he has no other resistances, beyond what equipment might give him.
    • Curare darts, if he isn't wearing poison resistance armour, will slow him down. This lets you keep pace with a berserk Rupert, and makes him weaker overall.
    • If he spawns with an axe, Rupert can mow down weak summons like its nothing. However, a few cactus giants are strong enough to take him down, axe or not.
    • Rupert cannot see invisible. If you need to get away, or get an edge in combat, a potion of invisibility can help.
    • If you got decent Evocations skill, a phial of floods prevents him from using Paralyse (but does not prevent berserk).
  • Rupert has a chance of spawning with one of the rare two-handers, such as a triple sword or executioner's axe. It's great if you were looking for one, but actually taking it from Rupert is easier said than done.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Rupert could see invisible.
  • While he and his spell set were unchanged, with the removal of the Berserker Rage player spell and the changing of Crusaders to Skalds, Rupert was restyled as a Trog worshiper in 0.9. The text for his Confuse and Paralyse spells was changed to match: apparently one can induce confusion and paralysis by yelling loudly enough.
